section.p: CRUMS is a small puzzle hunt created by a couple of crazy people in Providence, RI, one of whom is affiliated with Brown University. They felt that there weren't enough puzzle hunts in the world, so they made their own.

CRUMS will kick off on Saturday, 9/24 at noon EST (that's 2:00 a.m. on Sunday in Australian time). Puzzles and hints will be released during the subsequent 30 hours. The last hints will be released on Sunday, 9/25 at 2:00 p.m., and the hunt will officially conclude at 6:00 p.m. The puzzles will remain online indefinitely, though, so don't worry if you're a bit late to the party.

The internet! Speaking of parties, though, there will be an afterparty on Sunday, 9/25 at 7:00 p.m. There will be delicious snacks, and you'll be able to compare notes (or commiserate) with your fellow puzzlers. You'll receive the location of the party when you register; it's at our apartment, so please don't post the location online or invite anyone you don't actually know.
We think it's pretty sweet! That said, we're excited to hear your feedback after the hunt is over to help make future iterations go more smoothly.
This has gone on long enough. Let's get back to the real questions.
section.h3: How do I participate in CRUMS?
section.p: Assemble a team of up to 4 people and register on this very website. Create a team name and password (that you can remember!) that you will all use to submit answers.

In addition to the honor of writing the next CRUMS hunt, the team with the most points at the end of the hunt will receive a prize at our highly exclusive afterparty! If you can't make it to the afterparty, we'll be deeply disappointed, but we'll find a way to get you your prize.
section.h3: What is the scoring system like?
section.p:
Each puzzle (except the meta) will be worth a maximum of 3 points, minus 1 point for each hint that has been released. The meta will be worth 10 points, but there will not be any hints for it. Confused? Check out this sweet table:
Puzzle type #Hints Points
Non-meta 0 3
Non-meta 1 2
Non-meta 2 1
Meta 0 10
*Ties will be broken based on average solve time
We don't think so, but if you do have a question that isn't answered here, please feel free to drop us a line at contact@crumspuzzlehunt.com. Good luck and have fun!
